newsitem.title: UK: NWE high sulphur VGO steady on good buying.
newsitem.headline: NWE high sulphur VGO steady on good buying.

text.p: High sulphur VGO prices steadied on continental buying but low sulphur slipped back as waning U.S. interest in the product left it lacklustre in Europe, traders said on Wednesday.

Russian cargoes and local production was satisfying high sulphur VGO buyers in mainland Europe, one trader said, and keeping prices stable around the $134-$135 level for fob cargoes. The usual small Russian cargoes were said to be appearing at a rate of two a week.
Weaker U.S. prices were holding low sulphur product out of North America, although one trader said he believed the arbitrage still open for large cargoes heading west.
A refinery catcracker shutdown in Venezuala had put more VGO on the market and product was packing storage again, traders added.
"Traders went long there and can't sell," said one buyer. Low sulphur VGO cargoes drifted down to around $140/$142 fob NWE. -- London newsroom +44 171 542 8060
